31#include <sys/cdefs.h>
32__KERNEL_RCSID(0, "$NetBSD: intel_guc_loader.c,v 1.13 2018/09/13 08:25:55 mrg Exp $");
33
34#include <linux/firmware.h>
35#include <linux/module.h>
36#include "i915_drv.h"
37#include "intel_drv.h"
38#include "intel_guc.h"
39
40/**
41 * DOC: GuC
42 *
43 * intel_guc:
44 * Top level structure of guc. It handles firmware loading and manages client
45 * pool and doorbells. intel_guc owns a i915_guc_client to replace the legacy
46 * ExecList submission.
47 *
48 * Firmware versioning:
49 * The firmware build process will generate a version header file with major and
50 * minor version defined. The versions are built into CSS header of firmware.
51 * i915 kernel driver set the minimal firmware version required per platform.
52 * The firmware installation package will install (symbolic link) proper version
53 * of firmware.
54 *
55 * GuC address space:
56 * GuC does not allow any gfx GGTT address that falls into range [0, WOPCM_TOP),
57 * which is reserved for Boot ROM, SRAM and WOPCM. Currently this top address is
58 * 512K. In order to exclude 0-512K address space from GGTT, all gfx objects
59 * used by GuC is pinned with PIN_OFFSET_BIAS along with size of WOPCM.
60 *
61 * Firmware log:
62 * Firmware log is enabled by setting i915.guc_log_level to non-negative level.
63 * Log data is printed out via reading debugfs i915_guc_log_dump. Reading from
64 * i915_guc_load_status will print out firmware loading status and scratch
65 * registers value.
66 *
67 */
68
69#define I915_SKL_GUC_UCODE "i915/skl_guc_ver4.bin"
70MODULE_FIRMWARE(I915_SKL_GUC_UCODE);
71
72#define I915_KBL_GUC_UCODE "i915/kbl_guc_ver9_14.bin"
73MODULE_FIRMWARE(I915_KBL_GUC_UCODE);
74
75/* User-friendly representation of an enum */
76const char *intel_guc_fw_status_repr(enum intel_guc_fw_status status)
77{
78 switch (status) {
79 case GUC_FIRMWARE_FAIL:
80 return "FAIL";
81 case GUC_FIRMWARE_NONE:
82 return "NONE";
83 case GUC_FIRMWARE_PENDING:
84 return "PENDING";
85 case GUC_FIRMWARE_SUCCESS:
86 return "SUCCESS";
87 default:
88 return "UNKNOWN!";
89 }
90};
91
92static void direct_interrupts_to_host(struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv)
93{
94 struct intel_engine_cs *ring;
95 int i, irqs;
96
97 /* tell all command streamers NOT to forward interrupts and vblank to GuC */
98 irqs = _MASKED_FIELD(GFX_FORWARD_VBLANK_MASK, GFX_FORWARD_VBLANK_NEVER);
99 irqs |= _MASKED_BIT_DISABLE(GFX_INTERRUPT_STEERING);
100 for_each_ring(ring, dev_priv, i)
101 I915_WRITE(RING_MODE_GEN7(ring), irqs);
102
103 /* route all GT interrupts to the host */
104 I915_WRITE(GUC_BCS_RCS_IER, 0);
105 I915_WRITE(GUC_VCS2_VCS1_IER, 0);
106 I915_WRITE(GUC_WD_VECS_IER, 0);
107}
108
109static void direct_interrupts_to_guc(struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv)
110{
111 struct intel_engine_cs *ring;
112 int i, irqs;
113
114 /* tell all command streamers to forward interrupts and vblank to GuC */
115 irqs = _MASKED_FIELD(GFX_FORWARD_VBLANK_MASK, GFX_FORWARD_VBLANK_ALWAYS);
116 irqs |= _MASKED_BIT_ENABLE(GFX_INTERRUPT_STEERING);
117 for_each_ring(ring, dev_priv, i)
118 I915_WRITE(RING_MODE_GEN7(ring), irqs);
119
120 /* route USER_INTERRUPT to Host, all others are sent to GuC. */
121 irqs = GT_RENDER_USER_INTERRUPT << GEN8_RCS_IRQ_SHIFT |
122 GT_RENDER_USER_INTERRUPT << GEN8_BCS_IRQ_SHIFT;
123 /* These three registers have the same bit definitions */
124 I915_WRITE(GUC_BCS_RCS_IER, ~irqs);
125 I915_WRITE(GUC_VCS2_VCS1_IER, ~irqs);
126 I915_WRITE(GUC_WD_VECS_IER, ~irqs);
127}
128
129static u32 get_gttype(struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv)
130{
131 /* XXX: GT type based on PCI device ID? field seems unused by fw */
132 return 0;
133}
134
135static u32 get_core_family(struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv)
136{
137 switch (INTEL_INFO(dev_priv)->gen) {
138 case 9:
139 return GFXCORE_FAMILY_GEN9;
140
141 default:
142 DRM_ERROR("GUC: unsupported core family\n");
143 return GFXCORE_FAMILY_UNKNOWN;
144 }
145}
146
147static void set_guc_init_params(struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv)
148{
149 struct intel_guc *guc = &dev_priv->guc;
150 u32 params[GUC_CTL_MAX_DWORDS];
151 int i;
152
153 memset(&params, 0, sizeof(params));
154
155 params[GUC_CTL_DEVICE_INFO] |=
156 (get_gttype(dev_priv) << GUC_CTL_GTTYPE_SHIFT) |
157 (get_core_family(dev_priv) << GUC_CTL_COREFAMILY_SHIFT);
158
159 /*
160 * GuC ARAT increment is 10 ns. GuC default scheduler quantum is one
161 * second. This ARAR is calculated by:
162 * Scheduler-Quantum-in-ns / ARAT-increment-in-ns = 1000000000 / 10
163 */
164 params[GUC_CTL_ARAT_HIGH] = 0;
165 params[GUC_CTL_ARAT_LOW] = 100000000;
166
167 params[GUC_CTL_WA] |= GUC_CTL_WA_UK_BY_DRIVER;
168
169 params[GUC_CTL_FEATURE] |= GUC_CTL_DISABLE_SCHEDULER |
170 GUC_CTL_VCS2_ENABLED;
171
172 if (i915.guc_log_level >= 0) {
173 params[GUC_CTL_LOG_PARAMS] = guc->log_flags;
174 params[GUC_CTL_DEBUG] =
175 i915.guc_log_level << GUC_LOG_VERBOSITY_SHIFT;
176 }
177
178 /* If GuC submission is enabled, set up additional parameters here */
179 if (i915.enable_guc_submission) {
180 u32 pgs = i915_gem_obj_ggtt_offset(dev_priv->guc.ctx_pool_obj);
181 u32 ctx_in_16 = GUC_MAX_GPU_CONTEXTS / 16;
182
183 pgs >>= PAGE_SHIFT;
184 params[GUC_CTL_CTXINFO] = (pgs << GUC_CTL_BASE_ADDR_SHIFT) |
185 (ctx_in_16 << GUC_CTL_CTXNUM_IN16_SHIFT);
186
187 params[GUC_CTL_FEATURE] |= GUC_CTL_KERNEL_SUBMISSIONS;
188
189 /* Unmask this bit to enable the GuC's internal scheduler */
190 params[GUC_CTL_FEATURE] &= ~GUC_CTL_DISABLE_SCHEDULER;
191 }
192
193 I915_WRITE(SOFT_SCRATCH(0), 0);
194
195 for (i = 0; i < GUC_CTL_MAX_DWORDS; i++)
196 I915_WRITE(SOFT_SCRATCH(1 + i), params[i]);
197}
198
199/*
200 * Read the GuC status register (GUC_STATUS) and store it in the
201 * specified location; then return a boolean indicating whether
202 * the value matches either of two values representing completion
203 * of the GuC boot process.
204 *
205 * This is used for polling the GuC status in a wait_for_atomic()
206 * loop below.
207 */
208static inline bool guc_ucode_response(struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv,
209 u32 *status)
210{
211 u32 val = I915_READ(GUC_STATUS);
212 u32 uk_val = val & GS_UKERNEL_MASK;
213 *status = val;
214 return (uk_val == GS_UKERNEL_READY ||
215 ((val & GS_MIA_CORE_STATE) && uk_val == GS_UKERNEL_LAPIC_DONE));
216}
217
218/*
219 * Transfer the firmware image to RAM for execution by the microcontroller.
220 *
221 * GuC Firmware layout:
222 * +-------------------------------+ ----
223 * | CSS header | 128B
224 * | contains major/minor version |
225 * +-------------------------------+ ----
226 * | uCode |
227 * +-------------------------------+ ----
228 * | RSA signature | 256B
229 * +-------------------------------+ ----
230 *
231 * Architecturally, the DMA engine is bidirectional, and can potentially even
232 * transfer between GTT locations. This functionality is left out of the API
233 * for now as there is no need for it.
234 *
235 * Note that GuC needs the CSS header plus uKernel code to be copied by the
236 * DMA engine in one operation, whereas the RSA signature is loaded via MMIO.
237 */
238
239#define UOS_CSS_HEADER_OFFSET 0
240#define UOS_VER_MINOR_OFFSET 0x44
241#define UOS_VER_MAJOR_OFFSET 0x46
242#define UOS_CSS_HEADER_SIZE 0x80
243#define UOS_RSA_SIG_SIZE 0x100
244
245static int guc_ucode_xfer_dma(struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv)
246{
247 struct intel_guc_fw *guc_fw = &dev_priv->guc.guc_fw;
248 struct drm_i915_gem_object *fw_obj = guc_fw->guc_fw_obj;
249 unsigned long offset;
250#ifdef __NetBSD__
251 struct iovec iov;
252 struct uio uio;
253#else
254 struct sg_table *sg = fw_obj->pages;
255#endif
256 u32 status, ucode_size, rsa[UOS_RSA_SIG_SIZE / sizeof(u32)];
257 int i, ret = 0;
258
259 /* uCode size, also is where RSA signature starts */
260 offset = ucode_size = guc_fw->guc_fw_size - UOS_RSA_SIG_SIZE;
261 I915_WRITE(DMA_COPY_SIZE, ucode_size);
262
263 /* Copy RSA signature from the fw image to HW for verification */
264#ifdef __NetBSD__
265 iov.iov_base = rsa;
266 iov.iov_len = UOS_RSA_SIG_SIZE;
267 uio.uio_iov = &iov;
268 uio.uio_iovcnt = 1;
269 uio.uio_offset = offset;
270 uio.uio_resid = UOS_RSA_SIG_SIZE;
271 uio.uio_rw = UIO_READ;
272 UIO_SETUP_SYSSPACE(&uio);
273 /* XXX errno NetBSD->Linux */
274 ret = -ubc_uiomove(fw_obj->base.filp, &uio, UOS_RSA_SIG_SIZE,
275 UVM_ADV_NORMAL, UBC_READ);
276 if (ret)
277 return ret;
278#else
279 sg_pcopy_to_buffer(sg->sgl, sg->nents, rsa, UOS_RSA_SIG_SIZE, offset);
280#endif
281 for (i = 0; i < UOS_RSA_SIG_SIZE / sizeof(u32); i++)
282 I915_WRITE(UOS_RSA_SCRATCH(i), rsa[i]);
283
284 /* Set the source address for the new blob */
285 offset = i915_gem_obj_ggtt_offset(fw_obj);
286 I915_WRITE(DMA_ADDR_0_LOW, lower_32_bits(offset));
287 I915_WRITE(DMA_ADDR_0_HIGH, upper_32_bits(offset) & 0xFFFF);
288
289 /*
290 * Set the DMA destination. Current uCode expects the code to be
291 * loaded at 8k; locations below this are used for the stack.
292 */
293 I915_WRITE(DMA_ADDR_1_LOW, 0x2000);
294 I915_WRITE(DMA_ADDR_1_HIGH, DMA_ADDRESS_SPACE_WOPCM);
295
296 /* Finally start the DMA */
297 I915_WRITE(DMA_CTRL, _MASKED_BIT_ENABLE(UOS_MOVE | START_DMA));
298
299 /*
300 * Spin-wait for the DMA to complete & the GuC to start up.
301 * NB: Docs recommend not using the interrupt for completion.
302 * Measurements indicate this should take no more than 20ms, so a
303 * timeout here indicates that the GuC has failed and is unusable.
304 * (Higher levels of the driver will attempt to fall back to
305 * execlist mode if this happens.)
306 */
307 ret = wait_for_atomic(guc_ucode_response(dev_priv, &status), 100);
308
309 DRM_DEBUG_DRIVER("DMA status 0x%x, GuC status 0x%x\n",
310 I915_READ(DMA_CTRL), status);
311
312 if ((status & GS_BOOTROM_MASK) == GS_BOOTROM_RSA_FAILED) {
313 DRM_ERROR("GuC firmware signature verification failed\n");
314 ret = -ENOEXEC;
315 }
316
317 DRM_DEBUG_DRIVER("returning %d\n", ret);
318
319 return ret;
320}
321
322/*
323 * Load the GuC firmware blob into the MinuteIA.
324 */
325static int guc_ucode_xfer(struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv)
326{
327 struct intel_guc_fw *guc_fw = &dev_priv->guc.guc_fw;
328 struct drm_device *dev = dev_priv->dev;
329 int ret;
330
331 ret = i915_gem_object_set_to_gtt_domain(guc_fw->guc_fw_obj, false);
332 if (ret) {
333 DRM_DEBUG_DRIVER("set-domain failed %d\n", ret);
334 return ret;
335 }
336
337 ret = i915_gem_obj_ggtt_pin(guc_fw->guc_fw_obj, 0, 0);
338 if (ret) {
339 DRM_DEBUG_DRIVER("pin failed %d\n", ret);
340 return ret;
341 }
342
343 /* Invalidate GuC TLB to let GuC take the latest updates to GTT. */
344 I915_WRITE(GEN8_GTCR, GEN8_GTCR_INVALIDATE);
345
346 intel_uncore_forcewake_get(dev_priv, FORCEWAKE_ALL);
347
348 /* init WOPCM */
349 I915_WRITE(GUC_WOPCM_SIZE, GUC_WOPCM_SIZE_VALUE);
350 I915_WRITE(DMA_GUC_WOPCM_OFFSET, GUC_WOPCM_OFFSET_VALUE);
351
352 /* Enable MIA caching. GuC clock gating is disabled. */
353 I915_WRITE(GUC_SHIM_CONTROL, GUC_SHIM_CONTROL_VALUE);
354
355 /* WaDisableMinuteIaClockGating:skl,bxt */
356 if ((IS_SKYLAKE(dev) && INTEL_REVID(dev) <= SKL_REVID_B0) ||
357 (IS_BROXTON(dev) && INTEL_REVID(dev) == BXT_REVID_A0)) {
358 I915_WRITE(GUC_SHIM_CONTROL, (I915_READ(GUC_SHIM_CONTROL) &
359 ~GUC_ENABLE_MIA_CLOCK_GATING));
360 }
361
362 /* WaC6DisallowByGfxPause*/
363 I915_WRITE(GEN6_GFXPAUSE, 0x30FFF);
364
365 if (IS_BROXTON(dev))
366 I915_WRITE(GEN9LP_GT_PM_CONFIG, GT_DOORBELL_ENABLE);
367 else
368 I915_WRITE(GEN9_GT_PM_CONFIG, GT_DOORBELL_ENABLE);
369
370 if (IS_GEN9(dev)) {
371 /* DOP Clock Gating Enable for GuC clocks */
372 I915_WRITE(GEN7_MISCCPCTL, (GEN8_DOP_CLOCK_GATE_GUC_ENABLE |
373 I915_READ(GEN7_MISCCPCTL)));
374
375 /* allows for 5us before GT can go to RC6 */
376 I915_WRITE(GUC_ARAT_C6DIS, 0x1FF);
377 }
378
379 set_guc_init_params(dev_priv);
380
381 ret = guc_ucode_xfer_dma(dev_priv);
382
383 intel_uncore_forcewake_put(dev_priv, FORCEWAKE_ALL);
384
385 /*
386 * We keep the object pages for reuse during resume. But we can unpin it
387 * now that DMA has completed, so it doesn't continue to take up space.
388 */
389 i915_gem_object_ggtt_unpin(guc_fw->guc_fw_obj);
390
391 return ret;
392}
393
394/**
395 * intel_guc_ucode_load() - load GuC uCode into the device
396 * @dev: drm device
397 *
398 * Called from gem_init_hw() during driver loading and also after a GPU reset.
399 *
400 * The firmware image should have already been fetched into memory by the
401 * earlier call to intel_guc_ucode_init(), so here we need only check that
402 * is succeeded, and then transfer the image to the h/w.
403 *
404 * Return: non-zero code on error
405 */
406int intel_guc_ucode_load(struct drm_device *dev)
407{
408 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
409 struct intel_guc_fw *guc_fw = &dev_priv->guc.guc_fw;
410 int err = 0;
411
412 DRM_DEBUG_DRIVER("GuC fw status: fetch %s, load %s\n",
413 intel_guc_fw_status_repr(guc_fw->guc_fw_fetch_status),
414 intel_guc_fw_status_repr(guc_fw->guc_fw_load_status));
415
416 direct_interrupts_to_host(dev_priv);
417
418 if (guc_fw->guc_fw_fetch_status == GUC_FIRMWARE_NONE)
419 return 0;
420
421 if (guc_fw->guc_fw_fetch_status == GUC_FIRMWARE_SUCCESS &&
422 guc_fw->guc_fw_load_status == GUC_FIRMWARE_FAIL)
423 return -ENOEXEC;
424
425 guc_fw->guc_fw_load_status = GUC_FIRMWARE_PENDING;
426
427 DRM_DEBUG_DRIVER("GuC fw fetch status %s\n",
428 intel_guc_fw_status_repr(guc_fw->guc_fw_fetch_status));
429
430 switch (guc_fw->guc_fw_fetch_status) {
431 case GUC_FIRMWARE_FAIL:
432 /* something went wrong :( */
433 err = -EIO;
434 goto fail;
435
436 case GUC_FIRMWARE_NONE:
437 case GUC_FIRMWARE_PENDING:
438 default:
439 /* "can't happen" */
440 WARN_ONCE(1, "GuC fw %s invalid guc_fw_fetch_status %s [%d]\n",
441 guc_fw->guc_fw_path,
442 intel_guc_fw_status_repr(guc_fw->guc_fw_fetch_status),
443 guc_fw->guc_fw_fetch_status);
444 err = -ENXIO;
445 goto fail;
446
447 case GUC_FIRMWARE_SUCCESS:
448 break;
449 }
450
451 err = i915_guc_submission_init(dev);
452 if (err)
453 goto fail;
454
455 err = guc_ucode_xfer(dev_priv);
456 if (err)
457 goto fail;
458
459 guc_fw->guc_fw_load_status = GUC_FIRMWARE_SUCCESS;
460
461 DRM_DEBUG_DRIVER("GuC fw status: fetch %s, load %s\n",
462 intel_guc_fw_status_repr(guc_fw->guc_fw_fetch_status),
463 intel_guc_fw_status_repr(guc_fw->guc_fw_load_status));
464
465 if (i915.enable_guc_submission) {
466 /* The execbuf_client will be recreated. Release it first. */
467 i915_guc_submission_disable(dev);
468
469 err = i915_guc_submission_enable(dev);
470 if (err)
471 goto fail;
472 direct_interrupts_to_guc(dev_priv);
473 }
474
475 return 0;
476
477fail:
478 if (guc_fw->guc_fw_load_status == GUC_FIRMWARE_PENDING)
479 guc_fw->guc_fw_load_status = GUC_FIRMWARE_FAIL;
480
481 direct_interrupts_to_host(dev_priv);
482 i915_guc_submission_disable(dev);
483
484 return err;
485}
486
487static void guc_fw_fetch(struct drm_device *dev, struct intel_guc_fw *guc_fw)
488{
489 struct drm_i915_gem_object *obj;
490 const struct firmware *fw;
491 const u8 *css_header;
492 const size_t minsize = UOS_CSS_HEADER_SIZE + UOS_RSA_SIG_SIZE;
493 const size_t maxsize = GUC_WOPCM_SIZE_VALUE + UOS_RSA_SIG_SIZE
494 - 0x8000; /* 32k reserved (8K stack + 24k context) */
495 int err;
496
497 DRM_DEBUG_DRIVER("before requesting firmware: GuC fw fetch status %s\n",
498 intel_guc_fw_status_repr(guc_fw->guc_fw_fetch_status));
499
500 err = request_firmware(&fw, guc_fw->guc_fw_path, dev->dev);
501 if (err)
502 goto fail;
503 if (!fw)
504 goto fail;
505
506 DRM_DEBUG_DRIVER("fetch GuC fw from %s succeeded, fw %p\n",
507 guc_fw->guc_fw_path, fw);
508 DRM_DEBUG_DRIVER("firmware file size %zu (minimum %zu, maximum %zu)\n",
509 fw->size, minsize, maxsize);
510
511 /* Check the size of the blob befoe examining buffer contents */
512 if (fw->size < minsize || fw->size > maxsize)
513 goto fail;
514
515 /*
516 * The GuC firmware image has the version number embedded at a well-known
517 * offset within the firmware blob; note that major / minor version are
518 * TWO bytes each (i.e. u16), although all pointers and offsets are defined
519 * in terms of bytes (u8).
520 */
521 css_header = fw->data + UOS_CSS_HEADER_OFFSET;
522 guc_fw->guc_fw_major_found = *(const u16 *)(css_header + UOS_VER_MAJOR_OFFSET);
523 guc_fw->guc_fw_minor_found = *(const u16 *)(css_header + UOS_VER_MINOR_OFFSET);
524
525 if (guc_fw->guc_fw_major_found != guc_fw->guc_fw_major_wanted ||
526 guc_fw->guc_fw_minor_found < guc_fw->guc_fw_minor_wanted) {
527 DRM_ERROR("GuC firmware version %d.%d, required %d.%d\n",
528 guc_fw->guc_fw_major_found, guc_fw->guc_fw_minor_found,
529 guc_fw->guc_fw_major_wanted, guc_fw->guc_fw_minor_wanted);
530 err = -ENOEXEC;
531 goto fail;
532 }
533
534 DRM_DEBUG_DRIVER("firmware version %d.%d OK (minimum %d.%d)\n",
535 guc_fw->guc_fw_major_found, guc_fw->guc_fw_minor_found,
536 guc_fw->guc_fw_major_wanted, guc_fw->guc_fw_minor_wanted);
537
538 mutex_lock(&dev->struct_mutex);
539 obj = i915_gem_object_create_from_data(dev, fw->data, fw->size);
540 mutex_unlock(&dev->struct_mutex);
541 if (IS_ERR_OR_NULL(obj)) {
542 err = obj ? PTR_ERR(obj) : -ENOMEM;
543 goto fail;
544 }
545
546 guc_fw->guc_fw_obj = obj;
547 guc_fw->guc_fw_size = fw->size;
548
549 DRM_DEBUG_DRIVER("GuC fw fetch status SUCCESS, obj %p\n",
550 guc_fw->guc_fw_obj);
551
552 release_firmware(fw);
553 guc_fw->guc_fw_fetch_status = GUC_FIRMWARE_SUCCESS;
554 return;
555
556fail:
557 DRM_DEBUG_DRIVER("GuC fw fetch status FAIL; err %d, fw %p, obj %p\n",
558 err, fw, guc_fw->guc_fw_obj);
559 DRM_ERROR("Failed to fetch GuC firmware from %s (error %d)\n",
560 guc_fw->guc_fw_path, err);
561
562 obj = guc_fw->guc_fw_obj;
563 if (obj)
564 drm_gem_object_unreference(&obj->base);
565 guc_fw->guc_fw_obj = NULL;
566
567 release_firmware(fw); /* OK even if fw is NULL */
568 guc_fw->guc_fw_fetch_status = GUC_FIRMWARE_FAIL;
569}
570
571/**
572 * intel_guc_ucode_init() - define parameters and fetch firmware
573 * @dev: drm device
574 *
575 * Called early during driver load, but after GEM is initialised.
576 *
577 * The firmware will be transferred to the GuC's memory later,
578 * when intel_guc_ucode_load() is called.
579 */
580void intel_guc_ucode_init(struct drm_device *dev)
581{
582 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
583 struct intel_guc_fw *guc_fw = &dev_priv->guc.guc_fw;
584 const char *fw_path;
585
586 if (!HAS_GUC_SCHED(dev))
587 i915.enable_guc_submission = false;
588
589 if (!HAS_GUC_UCODE(dev)) {
590 fw_path = NULL;
591 } else if (IS_SKYLAKE(dev)) {
592 fw_path = I915_SKL_GUC_UCODE;
593 guc_fw->guc_fw_major_wanted = 4;
594 guc_fw->guc_fw_minor_wanted = 3;
595 } else if (IS_KABYLAKE(dev)) {
596 fw_path = I915_KBL_GUC_UCODE;
597 guc_fw->guc_fw_major_wanted = 9;
598 guc_fw->guc_fw_minor_wanted = 14;
599 } else {
600 i915.enable_guc_submission = false;
601 fw_path = ""; /* unknown device */
602 }
603
604 guc_fw->guc_dev = dev;
605 guc_fw->guc_fw_path = fw_path;
606 guc_fw->guc_fw_fetch_status = GUC_FIRMWARE_NONE;
607 guc_fw->guc_fw_load_status = GUC_FIRMWARE_NONE;
608
609 if (fw_path == NULL)
610 return;
611
612 if (*fw_path == '\0') {
613 DRM_ERROR("No GuC firmware known for this platform\n");
614 guc_fw->guc_fw_fetch_status = GUC_FIRMWARE_FAIL;
615 return;
616 }
617
618 guc_fw->guc_fw_fetch_status = GUC_FIRMWARE_PENDING;
619 DRM_DEBUG_DRIVER("GuC firmware pending, path %s\n", fw_path);
620 guc_fw_fetch(dev, guc_fw);
621 /* status must now be FAIL or SUCCESS */
622}
623
624/**
625 * intel_guc_ucode_fini() - clean up all allocated resources
626 * @dev: drm device
627 */
628void intel_guc_ucode_fini(struct drm_device *dev)
629{
630 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
631 struct intel_guc_fw *guc_fw = &dev_priv->guc.guc_fw;
632
633 direct_interrupts_to_host(dev_priv);
634 i915_guc_submission_fini(dev);
635
636 mutex_lock(&dev->struct_mutex);
637 if (guc_fw->guc_fw_obj)
638 drm_gem_object_unreference(&guc_fw->guc_fw_obj->base);
639 guc_fw->guc_fw_obj = NULL;
640 mutex_unlock(&dev->struct_mutex);
641
642 guc_fw->guc_fw_fetch_status = GUC_FIRMWARE_NONE;
643}
